content.raw:
This [tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/1.3/VRC_Plugin_Golf_Cart_With_Atlas) suggests we can use the current vehicle for developing the perception elements of driving.

However, the car model is completely different visually versus for collision (see attached still of the actual collision elements). Also LIDAR returns are from the collision model (which is just a sparse plate with wheels) - meaning that perception fusion isn't possible. 

Its not really possible to develop a perception framework when the elements are so different. Can you close the gap between the two models?

Also the visual elements currently chosen for the wheel and pedals are unnecessarily difficult. In particular the wheel is a single featureless wheel with no fiducials. Could this be changed to something like a typical steering wheel:
http://us.123rf.com/400wm/400/400/yanas/yanas1112/yanas111200009/11831005-steering-wheel-on-a-white.jpg

Or could visual markers be added - as in the attached image?
